body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park           Learn About the Park                   Discover a time when even beaches were...               Find out more about the story of Fort Caroline.               Interested in bringing a school group to the...               Learn about Timucuan's amazing biodiversity.               Uncover the stories of the free and enslaved.          Â    With 6,000 years of human history and thousands of acres of woods, water, and salt marsh there is so much to learn about in the Timucuan Preserve.  History & Culture -Explore the story behind the first French colony in what is now the United States, discover a story of freedom and enslavement at Kingsley Plantation and learn about the culture of the Timucua people for whom this park is named.  Nature -In and around one of the East coasts largest urban areas, our park offers rare glimpses of Old Florida, wildlife, and diverse habitats.  News -Browse press releases and subscribe to update to keep current with what is happening in the park.  Photos & Social Media -Experience the park through our photos and videos.  Stay connected through Facebook and Twitter.   For Teachers -Learn about the wonderful educational opportunities for you and your students in the park.  From lesson plans to field trips we hope you see parks as great classrooms.   Kids -Want to learn more about becoming a Junior Ranger?  Special kid's brochures, activities, and programs are waiting for you in the Timucuan Preserve.
title: Timucuan Ecological & Historic Preserve: Learn About the Park
